p:
Zink et al.
39 studied the structure–activity relationships of preussomerin G ( 101), H ( 102), I ( 103), D ( 104), deoxypreussomerin A ( 105) and B ( 106) extracted from the coprophilous fungus Preussia isomera, and the endophytic fungus Harmonema dematioides
123–125 which are fungal metabolites. They have a certain inhibitory activity on FTase. Among them, compound 101 has the strongest activity, not only against FTase, but also GGTase (IC 50 = 1.2 and 20 μM).
